description:
The story begins when an entire high school class of 32 people receive a message on their cellphones from a person known only as the "King." The messages contain orders that the students must obey, or they risk the punishment of death. With their lives on the line, the students soon find out that the orders are getting more and more extreme as time goes on.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/6gs05bgw86ufxu8)

Born in Hiroshima Prefecture in '82. After graduating from college, he worked on IT-related work while writing a novel, "King's Game." The series currently counts eight books and is being developed in various media such as manga and movies.

__Place of Birth:__ Higashimurayama-shi, Tokyo, Japan
__Hometown:__ Kokubunji, Tokyo, Japan

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tokihiro.sasaki)**

A Japanese director, series composer, episode director, animator, animation director, and storyboard artist.

__[Website](http://coldrain.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/coldrain_jp)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/coldrainofficial)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/coldrain_official/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4pCVGaLWxDe4d8bsjsnmUM)__

__Introduction:__
Coldrain (stylized as coldrain) is a Japanese five-piece rock band from Nagoya, Japan. The band mixes melodic singing with screams resembling the post-hardcore genre, and while the band are indeed Japanese, all of their songs are written in English. 

__Biography:__
Masato "David" Hayakawa (being the lead vocalist) has a Japanese father and an American mother and speaks both Japanese and English, which is also a main influencer in their choice of pure English songs. After the first two albums, Final Destination and The Enemy Inside, which were only released in Japan, the group made their initial worldwide debut in 2014 with the album The Revelation, released by Hopeless Records and Sony.

After the disbandment of the bands Wheel of Life (where RxYxO, Sugi and Y.K.C used to be) and AVER (where Masato and Katsuma used to be), coldrain was formed in Nagoya, Japan with Masato David Hayakawa on vocals, RxYxO (otherwise known as Ryo) on bass guitar, Katsuma on drums, and Y.K.C (Yokochi) and Sugi on guitars. The common musical interest of the members was one of the decisive factors in the formation of coldrain. Once, when AVER and Wheel of Life first co-debuted on stage, and AVER heard Sevendust's song played during Wheel of Life's rehearsal, an excited Katsuma asked RxYxO, "Don't tell me you're a fan of Sevendust as well!?" Thereafter, each time they interacted, they wanted to form a new band together. RxYxO was originally doing vocals, but became a bassist because of coldrain. The band gained their first followers from performing as a local band in their home-town while distributing demo discs after each performance.

__Members:__
• **Masato** - [Masato David Hayakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/150858), born December 17, 1986 (Songwriter, composer and main vocalist)
• **Y.K.C** - [Ryo Yokochi](https://anilist.co/staff/150861), born November 7, 1982 (Lead guitarist, programmer and pianist)
• **Sugi** - Kazuya Sugiyama, born April 3, 1982 (Rhythm guitarist, baritone guitarist and backing vocalist)
• **RxYxO** - Ryo Shimizu, born March 12, 1983 (Bass guitarist and backing vocalist)
• **Katsuma** - Katsuma Minatani, born March 18, 1987 (Drummer and percussionist)

__[Official Website](https://pile.asia/) | [Official Blog](https://lineblog.me/pile_official/) | [Old Blog](https://ameblo.jp/pile0502/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/pile_eric) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/pi_channnn52/)__

Pile is a Japanese singer and voice actress. She is of Japanese and Korean descent.
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/龍輪直征)

He began his career in 2000 as an animator at Studio Giants; in 2004, he began working for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/), where in 2011 he made his debut as a director with [Katte ni Kaizou](https://anilist.co/anime/10191/). In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).

__Place of Birth:__ Higashimurayama-shi, Tokyo, Japan
__Hometown:__ Kokubunji, Tokyo, Japan

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tokihiro.sasaki)**

A Japanese director, series composer, episode director, animator, animation director, and storyboard artist.
